pros: Near the dorms. Nice work environment
cons: The are no cons to this job

job_title: Associate Professor of Business in Lincoln, NE
pros: While I believe in positivity, my experience at Nebraska Wesleyan University was not good. It was very challenging. So, based on my experience, there were very little pros. However, there were colleagues in which there was a good experience.
cons: Based on my experience at Nebraska Wesleyan University, I felt like I was treated very unfairly. I did not feel as if I could trust some of the people in leadership positions, particularly given a situation in which information was presented inaccurately and not kept confidential.

pros: I’m an alum and feel a great deal of pride working for the university. The people are friendly and we are all working toward the same goal.
cons: The hours during the recruiting season can be challenging and there is not much opportunity for advancement.
Can only work 10 hours a week generally

pros: i learned a lot working there
cons: i worked short hours per day

review_title: Friendly environment feels like one big family
pros: NWU prides itself on making a community of its workers and students and I felt a sense of belonging there that I have rarely felt working professionally.  The staff is professional yet warm and inviting and the overall sense is that you want to contribute more and be a part of the excitement on campus.
cons: The university is still quite small compared with other organizations in the area (e.g. SCC and UNL) which may contribute to lower pay, however the work life balance makes up for this

pros: They sell themselves as high quality education and that is exactly what they are. Great place to work with friendly people.
cons: Not highly paid. Advancement is a tough prospect with it being a smaller university with long term employees. But they are great for a resume.

job_title: Biology Teacher Assistant/Research Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: Very easy to work with the professors and flexible hours allowed to get school work done but still adding valuable experience.
cons: On the research side, I had to sometimes go in on weekends or during summer break hours in order to complete my work.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Lincoln, NE
pros: Good environment, they seem to care about the students and wellbeing of the faculty as long as they are not discussing about money.
cons: Relatively low salaries compared with other universities/industry but I think they try to do the bes with what they have.
